com.sun.darkstar.example.snowman.server.impl
Class SnowmanPlayerImpl

java.lang.Object
  com.sun.darkstar.example.snowman.server.impl.SnowmanPlayerImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.sun.darkstar.example.snowman.common.protocol.processor.IProtocolProcessor, com.sun.darkstar.example.snowman.common.protocol.processor.IServerProcessor, DynamicEntity, SnowmanPlayer, com.sun.sgs.app.ManagedObject, Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
RobotImpl
public class SnowmanPlayerImpl
extends Object
implements SnowmanPlayer, Serializable, com.sun.darkstar.example.snowman.common.protocol.processor.IServerProcessor

This class is the player's "proxy" in the world of managed objects. It implements the ClientSessionListener interface so that it can be the reception point for all client session events. For here, it will call other managed ibjects to respond to thsoe events.

Author:
Jeffrey Kesselman, Owen Kellett, Yi Wang (Neakor)
See Also:

getExpectedPositionAtTime

public com.sun.darkstar.example.snowman.common.util.Coordinate getExpectedPositionAtTime(long time)
This method calculates the projected current position. If the player is not moving, it simply gives the current position as represented by startX and startY. If the player is moving, it calculates the position based on the last known timestamp, the currently given timestamp, the speed (which is calculated according to the current hit points), and the current destination.

Specified by:
getExpectedPositionAtTime in interface SnowmanPlayer
Parameters:
time - the time to calculate the position of the player
Returns:
the position of the player at the given time

                  float y)

Specified by:
score in interface com.sun.darkstar.example.snowman.common.protocol.processor.IServerProcessor

score

protected boolean score(long now,
                        float x,
                        float y)
Attempt to score. If sucessful return true. Note that a true return may mean that the currentGameRef will no longer resolve to a game object.

Parameters:
now - time that the player attempts to score
x - x coordinate of the player
y - y coordinate of the player
Returns:
success
See Also:
IServerProcessor.score(float, float)
